author: georgen
title: The best tractor?
review:
This may just be the best of the Technic Tractors.  8859 is fantastic and has a great array of rear implements, but this beat it I believe.

Suspension on the front wheels.  A far better arrangement for the 3-point hitch and better steering with a tighter lock and 'hand of god' available as well as the in-cab wheel.

All round this is a great example of technic construction with some creative building techniques.  And it makes a model that is great for display, but also fantastic for playing with.

author: TechnicNick
title: Very Nice, But...
review:
As the successor to the bigger 8859, this set sought to incorporate as many features in a smaller model and largely succeeded - it lost the engine but gained a cleverly contrived pendular front axle with 'hand of god' steering to enhance playability.

The trouble is that any implement on the back (even the lightweight one it comes with) causes it to tip back as soon as you breathe on it - weight distribution is not good. This makes it less useful than the much more basic, but prettier, old 851 tractor - a model that still shows this some tricks with it's longer wheelbase and smoother operation.

On the plus side, this is a convincing looking model, in a usefully tighter package than 8859, but I would prefer either of it's forebears.

The second model isn't brilliant either.. not one of my favourites, then, but it has it's points.
